page.title: 08Local History B'ham
page.content: There were 2 railway developments this century-1919 a Halt was built at Spring Road and in 1937 a station at Lea Hall. 1920-1939 council houses were built over 2,000 acres and private firms built houses for rent/sale in the southern quarter-Forman's Road to the Stratford Road and the River Cole. Most schools in the area were built between 1884-1910. Famous celebrities of the area include Tony Hancock,a 'comedian of Genius,' was born on the 12th May 1924 at 41 Southam Road. J.R.R.Tolkien lived in Wake Green Road by Moseley Bog which was his inspirational setting for his books 'The Hobbitt' and 'Lord of the Rings.' Well known landmarks include Sarehole Mill, Sparkhill Library(old council house), Moseley Bog and Moseley School.(a spa centre)
